dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool uses the GeoPy Python package in order to conduct a forward geocode using the various geocoding APIs.

Installing GeoPy

Note: If using the Google service, as a free user, you are limited to 2500 queries a day at a rate of 5 queries per second.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/usage-limits

tool.name: CoordinateLookup

param.name: inFeature
param.dialogReference: The POINT or POLYGON feature class with addresses to search.
param.pythonReference: A DEFeatureclass containing POINT or POLYGON features with addresses to search.

param.name: coordinatesExists
param.dialogReference:
Checked - Fields exist to store the lat/lon coordinates returned from the search.

Unchecked - Two fields named "Lat", and "Lon" field will be created to store the coordinates returned by the search. This is the DEFAULT.
param.pythonReference: A boolean specifying whether the fields Lat and Lon exist within the input feature class. If False, two fields named "Lat" and "Lon" will be created. Default is False.

param.name: addressField
param.dialogReference: The field containing address values to search.
param.pythonReference: A GPString specifying the fieldname of the attribute containing the address values to search.

param.name: latField
param.pythonReference: A GPString specifying the fieldname of the attribute in which the returned latitude value should be stored.

param.name: lonField
param.pythonReference: A GPString specifying the fieldname of the attribute in which the returned longitude value should be stored.

param.name: service
param.dialogReference: The service used to search for coordinates.
param.pythonReference: A GPString specying which geocoding service should be used. Valid values are Google and OpenStreetMap.

tool.summary:
This tool uses the GeoPy Python package in order to conduct a forward geocode using the various geocoding APIs.

Installing GeoPy

Note: If using the Google service, as a free user, you are limited to 2500 queries a day at a rate of 5 queries per second.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/usage-limits
tool.usage:
This tool uses various geocoding APIs to find a feature's lat/lon coordinates using its address.

The coordinates are populated to existing or newly created coordinate fields.
